comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] Thanks Danny. Was hoping we'd find something on the Quinns, because in our catalogue it says "Identified in an album as the Quinn children". And the Dillon family (the photographers), not the farmers you found above, were sometimes good at noting who was in the photographs they took, including dogs. Papa and Hay named in this one...

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The Quin family in 1911 featuring: Quin Jenny 18 Female Daughter Irish Church Quin Isabel 15 Female Daughter Irish Church Quin Margaret 13 Female Daughter Irish Church Quin Ellen Cathleen 11 Female Daughter Irish Church In 1903, Ellen Cathleen would be 3ish, Margaret 5ish and Isabel 7ish. Further, the original Census form .pdf says Quinn, so Quin is a mistranscription.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Jenny was born in Antrim, but Isabel in Co. Galway, so they should be in Galway in 1901 also... Yep, here they are. Margaret was Maggie in 1901, and Jenny was Mary Jane.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Brilliant, Niall, thanks! Am I wrong, but I can't find any sign of that family in 1901?

So, what do we think? Maybe Ellen and Margaret? Or Margaret and Isabel? (Subject to usual terms & conditions, that these are the Quin girls)
